Dear Eng. Abanoub,
 
Kindly fill in the blank cells/slides in the attached presentation, noting the following:
 
All figures to be in USD million, where 
USD = 50 EGP.
In the slide named “
Actual Q1-2025 Justifications/Area of Concern
”, you are kindly requested to highlight the major reasons for deviations between targets and actuals.
In the ‘
Revised Plan
” slide you are kindly requested to consider Q1 figures as actuals (already done), while making reasonable forecasts for the remaining quarters
’
 new targets.
In the slide named “
Required Actions to Achieve Revised Plan”
, you are kindly requested to provide the recommended actions to enable for achieving the new targets provided within the revised plan.
 
Kindly send your data as soon as possible, if you need any clarification, please do not hesitate to contact me.
 
Thanks and best regards,
 
Amr Hamada

Smart, Secure, and Sustainable Power and Cooling Solutions.
Smart, Secure, and Sustainable Power and Cooling Solutions.
Together, we can build better.
Mitsubishi Electric delivers integrated, smart, secure and sustainable power and cooling solutions tailored to your facility’s needs. Our products maximise uptime and power quality while minimising and optimising Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) to ensure a seamless balance between your total facility power usage and non-IT load consumption.
1
Ensure business continuity with our critical power solutions
We offer mission-critical containerised, modular and skidded Critical Power Stream PODS, or Power Train Units, medium voltage solutions, low voltage solutions, UPS, and back-up generators of the highest quality. Our technology ensures your data centres remain operational, safe and energy efficient.
 
2
Elevate your data centre infrastructure with our critical cooling solutions
Our critical cooling solutions for data centre infrastructures ensure optimal performance, reliability, and decrease running costs through energy-efficient equipment and by maintaining consistent temperatures and humidity levels, regardless of load variations.
 
3
Optimise your data centre performance with our DCIM solution
With our Data Centre Infrastructure Management (DCIM) solution, hyperscaler users and colocation operators can visualise and monitor data centre infrastructure more effectively, prevent downtime, avoid unnecessary energy costs, and secure critical information.
 
4
Level up your data centre with our containerised solutions
Our containerised solutions provide a blend of flexibility, efficiency, reliability, and quality, designed to meet the dynamic needs of modern data centres. They are built to withstand harsh environmental conditions, ensuring consistent performance and long-term reliability.
Get an overview of the added value Mitsubishi Electric can bring to your business
Watch video
Learn more
MITSUBISHI ELECTRIC EUROPE B.V
Harman House, 1 George Street, Uxbridge, Middlesex, UB8 1QQ, UK

--- Email 27 ---
Subject: Importance of Data Visualization in Business Intelligence
From: communications@yellowfinbi.com
Date: 2025-04-01T08:02:19Z
Body:
EXTERNAL EMAIL:
 
This email was sent by a person from outside your organization. Execute caution when clicking links, opening attachments or taking further action, before validating its authenticity.
 
What is Data Visualization and its Importance in Business Intelligence? 
 
 
 
What is Data Visualization and its Importance in Business Intelligence?
Data visualization is the practice of representing information graphically to communicate and contextualize data. When used correctly, visualizations help business people interpret complex data-sets, draw conclusions, and make informed decisions faster, and identify correlations they may not see in static tables or text-based reports alone.
Integrating business intelligence and 
data visualization tools
 allows companies to analyze data more effectively, uncover hidden insights, and make strategic decisions. Therefore, finding the right BI solution with data visualization built-in, is a critical need.
Some BI solutions assist organizations in selecting the best chart category, such as Yellowfin, which has an 
Autochart
 builder that automatically selects the best chart for your data selections, as well as provides a short explanation of what the chart is and what it is best intended for.
 
Increase the Value of Your Data
 
With its intuitive embedded data visualization tools, top business intelligence tools, Autochart builder, and interactive visualization capabilities, Yellowfin helps organizations across industries make informed decisions quickly. By adhering to best practices and leveraging the 5 C’s of data visualization, businesses can maximize the impact of their data and gain a competitive edge in today’s data-driven world.
Where do I get started with data visualization?
Whether you are analyzing KPIs, tracking trends, or uncovering hidden insights, Yellowfin’s BI solutions offer the tools needed to visualize data effectively and drive business success.
Try Yellowfin for Free

--- Email 72 ---
Subject: RE: Trial_Balance_Split_202503231104
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-24T12:19:52Z
Body:
Latest view 
 
CREATE
 
OR
 
REPLACE
 
VIEW
 Trial_Balance_Split 
AS
SELECT
 
    
`Year`
,
    
`Account Code`
,
    
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
`Account Code`
, 
'.'
, 
1
), 
'.'
, -
1
) 
AS
 
`company`
,                     
    
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
`Account Code`
, 
'.'
, 
2
), 
'.'
, -
1
) 
AS
 
`Account Code 02`
,             
    
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
`Account Code`
, 
'.'
, 
3
), 
'.'
, -
1
) 
AS
 
`Account Code 03`
,
    
LEFT
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
`Account Code`
, 
'.'
, 
3
), 
'.'
, -
1
), 
1
) 
AS
 
`First Digit`
,
    
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
`Account Code`
, 
'.'
, 
4
), 
'.'
, -
1
) 
AS
 
`cost center from code`
,                 
    
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
SUBSTRING_INDEX
(
`Account Code`
, 
'.'
, 
5
), 
'.'
, -
1
) 
AS
 
`project cost center`

),

, -
1

--- Email 82 ---
Subject: Internal Vacancies Announcement
From: Intranet@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-23T13:30:15Z
Body:
Department Human Resources Job Title Manpower Planning Senior Specialist Job Purpose  The Manpower Planning Senior Specialist, is responsible for maintaining workforce data, tracking staff allocation, and assisting in manpower forecasting & budgetin…
Internal Vacancies Announcement
 
Department
Human Resources
Job Title
Manpower Planning Senior Specialist
Job Purpose
 The 
Manpower Planning Senior Specialist, 
is responsible for maintaining workforce data, tracking staff allocation, and assisting in manpower forecasting & budgeting. This role focuses on data accuracy, reporting, and coordination with project teams to ensure efficient workforce distribution across construction sites.
 
Tasks and Responsibilities
Workforce Planning Support:
Analyze workforce needs and identify gaps between supply and demand.
Forecast headcount requirements based on business growth and project needs.
Periodically monitor and report on manpower activities and review actual manpower movements against planned to ensure that plans are adhered to, and variations are identified, and the necessary action is taken
Monitor daily staff deployment and highlight shortages or surpluses.
Collaborate with the Recruitment team to ensure hiring plans align with workforce requirements.
Data Management & Reporting:
Ensure that the workforce records in HITS HR System, ensuring accuracy in employee details, project assignments, and leave schedules.
Generate manpower reports using HITS.
Extract and compile data from HITS for monthly workforce planning reports.
 
KSA
Knowledge
Understanding manpower forecasting methods (trend analysis).
Ability to analyze attrition rates, headcount trends, and productivity metrics.
Familiarity with workforce optimization techniques (e.g., right-sizing, restructuring).
Understanding org charts, reporting lines, and job hierarchies.
Knowledge of career progression frameworks (e.g., specialist vs. leadership tracks).
Understanding succession planning and internal talent mobility.
Abilities
Strong 
presentation and communication skills
 with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Ability to Work with Large Workforce Data – Managing and organizing workforce details across multiple projects.
Oral Expression —
 The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
Speech Clarity —
 The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.
Deductive Reasoning —
 The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. 
Fluency of Ideas —
 The ability to come up with a few ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).
Originality —
 The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.
Problem Sensitivity —
 The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
Selective Attention — The ability to concentrate on a task over a period without being distracted.
 
Qualifications
Education
Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Economics, or a related field
.
Credentials
Human Resources Management Diploma (HRMD) is a plus.
Relevant Work Experience
Plus 5 years of experience in workforce planning, HR support, or manpower coordination (construction industry preferred). 
Manpower and Workforce Planning Senior Specialist
View in SharePoint
 
This email is generated through Rowad Modern Engineering's use of Microsoft 365 and may contain content that is controlled by Rowad Modern Engineering.
------------------------------------------------------------

from
 flask 
import
 Flask, render_template, send_file, request
import
 mysql.connector 
as
 mysql
import
 pandas 
as
 pd
import
 os
from
 sqlalchemy 
import
 create_engine
 
app 
=
 Flask(
__name__
)
 
# Database connection details
DB_CONFIG 
=
 {
    
"host"
: 
"10.10.11.242"
,
    
"user"
: 
"omar2"
,
    
"password"
: 
"Omar_54321"
,
    
"database"
: 
"RME_TEST"
}
TABLE_NAME 
=
 
"receipts_4_Report"
 
# Directory to store Excel files
OUTPUT_DIR 
=
 
r
"D:\site
\r
ev07\downloads"
os.makedirs(OUTPUT_DIR, 
exist_ok
=
True
)
 
# Route to load dropdown lists for Projects and Clients
 
from
 datetime 
import
 datetime 
 
@app.route
(
'/'
)
def
 
index
():
    
try
:
        db_uri 
=
 
f
"mysql+mysqlconnector://
{
DB_CONFIG[
'user'
]
}
:
{
DB_CONFIG[
'password'
]
}
@
{
DB_CONFIG[
'host'
]
}
/
{
DB_CONFIG[
'database'
]
}
"
        engine 
=
 create_engine(db_uri)
 
        
# Fetch and sort distinct project names
        query_projects 
=
 
"SELECT DISTINCT TRX_PRJ_NAME FROM receipts_4_Report WHERE TRX_PRJ_NAME IS NOT NULL"
        projects_df 
=
 pd.read_sql(query_projects, engine)
        project_names 
=
 projects_df[
'TRX_PRJ_NAME'
].dropna().astype(
str
).str.strip().tolist()
        project_names.sort()
 
        
# Fetch and sort distinct client names
        query_clients 
=
 
"SELECT DISTINCT CUSTOMER_NAME FROM receipts_4_Report WHERE CUSTOMER_NAME IS NOT NULL"
        clients_df 
=
 pd.read_sql(query_clients, engine)
        client_names 
=
 clients_df[
'CUSTOMER_NAME'
].dropna().astype(
str
).str.strip().tolist()
        client_names.sort()
 
        
return
 render_template(
'index.html'
, 
projects
=
project_names, 
clients
=
client_names)
 
    
except
 
Exception
 
as
 e:
        
print
(
"Error fetching dropdown data:"
, e)
        
return
 render_template(
'index.html'
, 
projects
=
[], 
clients
=
[])
 
import
 traceback
 
def
 
fetch_data
(
project_name
, 
client_name
, 
from_date
, 
to_date
):
    
try
:
        db_uri 
=
 
f
"mysql+mysqlconnector://
{
DB_CONFIG[
'user'
]
}
:
{
DB_CONFIG[
'password'
]
}
@
{
DB_CONFIG[
'host'
]
}
/
{
DB_CONFIG[
'database'
]
}
"
        engine 
=
 create_engine(db_uri)
 
        query 
=
 
f
"""
            SELECT 
                CAST(RECEIPT_ID AS CHAR) AS RECEIPT_ID,  
                RECEIPT_NUMBER, 
                CUSTOMER_NO, 
                CUSTOMER_NAME, 
                RECEIPT_PRJ_CODE, 
                RECEIPT_PRJ_NAME, 
                TRX_PRJ_CODE, 
                TRX_PRJ_NAME, 
                RECEIPT_DATE, 
                INV_NUM AS INVOICE_NO, 
                TRANSACTION_AMOUNT, 
                TAX_AMOUNT, 
                TOTAL_AFTER_TAX, 
                NEW_CALCULATED_TOTAL_ADJ AS DEDUCTIONS_ADJUSTMENTS, 
                CALCULATED_AMOUNT_TO_COLLECT, 
                STATUS AS APPLICATION_STATUS, 
                RECEIPT_AMOUNT, 
                AMOUNT_APPLIED, 
                ATTRIBUTE1 AS COLLECTION_TYPE, 
                TOTAL_AMOUNT_APPLIED, 
                AMOUNT_DUE_REMAINING 
            FROM 
{
TABLE_NAME
}
            WHERE 1=1
        """
 
        params 
=
 []
 
        
if
 project_name 
!=
 
"all"
:
            query 
+=
 
" AND TRX_PRJ_NAME = 
%s
"
            params.append(project_name)
 
        
if
 client_name 
!=
 
"all"
:
            query 
+=
 
" AND CUSTOMER_NAME = 
%s
"
            params.append(client_name)
 
        
if
 from_date:
            query 
+=
 
" AND RECEIPT_DATE >= 
%s
"
            params.append(from_date)
 
        
if
 to_date:
            query 
+=
 
" AND RECEIPT_DATE <= 
%s
"
            params.append(to_date)
 
        
print
(
f
"
🔍
 Executing SQL with params: 
{
params
}
"
)
        df 
=
 pd.read_sql(query, engine, 
params
=
tuple
(params))  
# 
✅
 FIXED HERE
 
        
if
 df.empty:
            
print
(
"
⚠️
 No data found."
)
            
return
 
None
 
        
# Rename columns
        col_map 
=
 {
            
"RECEIPT_ID"
: 
"RPT_ ID"
,
            
"RECEIPT_NUMBER"
: 
"RPT_NO"
,
            
"CUSTOMER_NO"
: 
"Client No."
,
            
"CUSTOMER_NAME"
: 
"Client Name"
,
            
"RECEIPT_PRJ_NAME"
: 
"RPT_Prj. Name"
,
            
"RECEIPT_PRJ_CODE"
: 
"RPT_Prj. Code"
,
            
"TRX_PRJ_NAME"
: 
"TRX_Prj. Name"
,
            
"TRX_PRJ_CODE"
: 
"TRX_Prj. Code"
,
            
"RECEIPT_DATE"
: 
"RPT_Date"
,
            
"INVOICE_NO"
: 
"Invoice No."
,
            
"TRANSACTION_AMOUNT"
: 
"Value Of Work"
,
            
"TAX_AMOUNT"
: 
"Tax"
,
            
"TOTAL_AFTER_TAX"
: 
"VOW After Tax"
,
            
"DEDUCTIONS_ADJUSTMENTS"
: 
"Deductions/Adjustments"
,
            
"CALCULATED_AMOUNT_TO_COLLECT"
: 
"Net"
,
            
"APPLICATION_STATUS"
: 
"Application Status"
,
            
"RECEIPT_AMOUNT"
: 
"RPT_Amount"
,
            
"AMOUNT_APPLIED"
: 
"Amount Applied"
,
            
"COLLECTION_TYPE"
: 
"Collection Type"
,
            
"TOTAL_AMOUNT_APPLIED"
: 
"Collected Amount"
,
            
"AMOUNT_DUE_REMAINING"
: 
"Variance"
        }
        df.rename(
columns
=
col_map, 
inplace
=
True
)
 
        df[
"RPT_Date"
] 
=
 pd.to_datetime(df[
"RPT_Date"
], 
errors
=
"coerce"
)
        file_name 
=
 
f
"Receipts_Report_
{
project_name
}
_
{
client_name
}
.xlsx"
.replace(
" "
, 
"_"
)
        file_path 
=
 os.path.join(OUTPUT_DIR, file_name)
 
        
# Generate Summary Table (backend-calculated, no formulas)
        summary_df 
=
 df[[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
, 
"Invoice No."
]].drop_duplicates().copy()
        summary_df[
"Value Of Work"
] 
=
 summary_df.apply(
            
lambda
 
row
: df.loc[
                (df[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
] 
==
 row[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
]) 
&
                (df[
"Invoice No."
] 
==
 row[
"Invoice No."
]),
                
"Value Of Work"
            ].max(), 
axis
=
1
        )
        summary_df[
"Net"
] 
=
 summary_df.apply(
            
lambda
 
row
: df.loc[
                (df[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
] 
==
 row[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
]) 
&
                (df[
"Invoice No."
] 
==
 row[
"Invoice No."
]),
                
"Net"
            ].max(), 
axis
=
1
        )
        summary_df[
"Amount Applied"
] 
=
 summary_df.apply(
            
lambda
 
row
: df.loc[
                (df[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
] 
==
 row[
"RPT_Prj. Name"
]) 
&
                (df[
"Invoice No."
] 
==
 row[
"Invoice No."
]),
                
"Amount Applied"
            ].sum(), 
axis
=
1
        )
 
        
# Write to Excel with formatting
        
with
 pd.ExcelWriter(file_path, 
engine
=
'xlsxwriter'
) 
as
 writer:
            
# Details Sheet
            df.to_excel(writer, 
sheet_name
=
"Details"
, 
index
=
False
)
            details_ws 
=
 writer.sheets[
"Details"
]
            workbook 
=
 writer.book
 
            
# Summary Sheet
            summary_df.to_excel(writer, 
sheet_name
=
"Summary"
, 
index
=
False
)
            summary_ws 
=
 writer.sheets[
"Summary"
]
 
            
# Style settings
            number_format 
=
 workbook.add_format({
"num_format"
: 
"#,##0"
})
            date_format 
=
 workbook.add_format({
"num_format"
: 
"DD-MMM-YY"
})
            text_format 
=
 workbook.add_format({
"num_format"
: 
"@"
})
 
            
# Format Details
            
for
 col_num, col 
in
 
enumerate
(df.columns):
                col_width 
=
 
max
(
12
, 
len
(col) 
+
 
2
)
                col_type 
=
 df[col].dtype
                
if
 col 
==
 
"RPT_Date"
:
                    details_ws.set_column(col_num, col_num, col_width, date_format)
                
elif
 pd.api.types.is_numeric_dtype(col_type) 
and
 col 
!=
 
"RPT_ ID"
:
                    details_ws.set_column(col_num, col_num, col_width, number_format)
                
else
:
                    details_ws.set_column(col_num, col_num, col_width)
 
            details_ws.freeze_panes(
1
, 
0
)
            summary_ws.freeze_panes(
1
, 
0
)
 
        
print
(
f
"
✅
 Excel report generated with summary: 
{
file_path
}
"
)
        
return
 file_path
 
    
except
 
Exception
 
as
 e:
        
import
 traceback
        
print
(
"
❌
 Error generating Excel:"
)
        
print
(traceback.format_exc())
        
return
 
None
 
# Route to download filtered Excel
@app.route
(
'/download'
, 
methods
=
[
'POST'
])
def
 
download_excel
():
    project_name 
=
 request.form.get(
"project_name"
, 
"all"
)
    client_name 
=
 request.form.get(
"client_name"
, 
"all"
)
    from_date 
=
 request.form.get(
"from_date"
) 
or
 
None
    to_date 
=
 request.form.get(
"to_date"
) 
or
 
None
 
    file_path 
=
 fetch_data(project_name, client_name, from_date, to_date)
    
if
 file_path 
and
 os.path.exists(file_path):
        
return
 send_file(file_path, 
as_attachment
=
True
)
 
    
return
 
"Error: Could not generate the report."
, 
500
 
# Run Flask app
if
 
__name__
 
==
 
'__main__'
:
    app.run(
debug
=
True
, 
host
=
"0.0.0.0"
, 
port
=
5000
)
------------------------------------------------------------

What Does It REALLY Take to Be Successful with Business Intelligence?
Serving up Success with Yellowfin

What Does It REALLY Take to Be Successful with Business Intelligence?
Business Intelligence (BI) sounds like a game-changer – and it can be. But here's the hard truth: having a great idea and a powerful tool like Yellowfin is just the beginning. Success demands more than good intentions. It requires a strategic roadmap.
Beyond the Buzzwords
In this exclusive webinar, we'll be sharing key insights on what it really takes to transform data into actionable business intelligence. Insights gleaned from years of front line experience.
What You'll Learn:
Why most BI initiatives fail (and how to beat the odds)
The critical steps to successful BI implementation
How to avoid the major pitfalls that derail data strategies
Practical techniques to turn your BI tool into a true business accelerator
Exclusive Insights:
Insider strategies most consultants won't tell you
Practical, immediately applicable BI success tactics
Warning:

https://www.dfki.de/en/web

Bid - No Bid Decision Using Fuzzy Risk Assessment
 (attached) 
Reclamation Computer Vision Monitoring (RCVM)
. This my PhD thesis proposal is developing a deep learning and computer vision model to monitor and schedule more than one and half million acres of Egypt's new Delta reclamation projects (attached). 
Prof. Ioannis Brilakis one of the pioneers in using computer vision in construction and turn to application, I am willing to apply a real practical application to be used worldwide in the construction industry

--- Email 153 ---
Subject: RE: sql to run with unifier projects
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-16T10:42:44Z
Body:
Included a query for them and one for all projet_num on erp with eng yasser’s certain request filter
 
SELECT
 
PROJECT_NUM
, 
SUM
(
AMOUNT
) 
AS
 
total_amount
FROM
 
RME_Projects_Cost_Dist_Line_Report
WHERE
 
TRANSACTION_SOURCE
 = 
'WORK_CONFRIMATION'
AND
 
PROJECT_NUM
 
IN
 (
    
'0137'
, 
'0141'
, 
'0142'
, 
'0138'
, 
'0145'
, 
'0123'
, 
'0147'
, 
'0144'
, 
'C0001'
,
    
'0148'
, 
'0158'
, 
'0151'
, 
'0159'
, 
'P0001'
, 
'0126'
,
    
'0172'
, 
'0164'
, 
'0175'
, 
'0173'
, 
'0181'
, 
'0170'
, 
'0182'
, 
'0177'
, 
'0183'
,
    
'RG001'
, 
'0171'
, 
'0194'
, 
'0184'
, 
'0185'
, 
'0196'
, 
'0198'
, 
'0203'
, 
'0204'
,
    
'0205'
, 
'0161'
, 
'0149'
, 
'0150'
, 
'0139'
, 
'0133'
, 
'0140'
, 
'0143'
, 
'0152'
,
    
'0160'
, 
'0153'
, 
'0166'
, 
'0157'
, 
'0169'
, 
'0168'
, 
'0176'
, 
'0167'
, 
'0163'
,
    
'0078'
, 
'0179'
, 
'0125'
, 
'0174'
, 
'0213'
, 
'0213.'
, 
'0217'
, 
'0219'
)
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NUM
;
 
And
 
SELECT
 
PROJECT_NUM
, 
SUM
(
AMOUNT
) 
AS
 
total_amount
FROM
 
RME_Projects_Cost_Dist_Line_Report
WHERE
 
TRANSACTION_SOURCE
 = 
'WORK_CONFRIMATION'
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NUM
;

How to Lower TCO and Increase ROI with Embedded Analytics
Are you searching for a cost-effective and time-friendly solution to help modernize your business?
The value proposition of embedded analytics has never been clearer: Integrate best-in-class analytics into your existing software, and bring real-time data and insights directly to your user base while they use your platform.
With the ability to use dashboards, reports and other powerful AI analytics tools all in the same core workflow, embedded analytics solutions can help you to:
Better identify inefficiencies and streamline operations
Lower the total cost of ownership (TCO)
Boost your return-on-investment (ROI)

What is the total cost of ownership (TCO) of embedded analytics?

How embedded BI can enhance user engagement and satisfaction

What Does It REALLY Take to Be Successful with Business Intelligence?
Business Intelligence (BI) sounds like a game-changer – and it can be. But here's the hard truth: having a great idea and a powerful tool like Yellowfin is just the beginning. Success demands more than good intentions. It requires a strategic roadmap.
Beyond the Buzzwords
In this exclusive webinar, we'll be sharing key insights on what it really takes to transform data into actionable business intelligence. Insights gleaned from years of front line experience.
What You'll Learn:
Why most BI initiatives fail (and how to beat the odds)
The critical steps to successful BI implementation
How to avoid the major pitfalls that derail data strategies
Practical techniques to turn your BI tool into a true business accelerator
Exclusive Insights:
Insider strategies most consultants won't tell you
Practical, immediately applicable BI success tactics

--- Email 224 ---
Subject: Ramadan Prayer Time مواقيت الصلاة اليوم 10 رمضان
From: intranet@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-10T07:30:11Z

------------------------------------------------------------

--- Email 225 ---
Subject: Ramadan Mental Wellbeing Hike 
From: CSR@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-09T13:13:02Z
Body:
Dear Rowad Team,
 
We are excited to invite you to a special Ramadan Mental Wellbeing Hike on Saturday, March 15th at Wadi Degla, joined by our CEO, Eng. Mohamed Mahlab, who will accompany us on this meaningful walk.
 
The hike will be hosted by Sherif El Abd, Customer Advisory Strategy Director at Oracle and Active Athlete who will be donating EGP 50 per kilometer walked to NGOs in Sinai. Rowad will match his donation based on our team’s participation. Sherif will also host Omar El Sawy, a Trail & Ultra Running Coach and founder of Ultra Bedu, who will lead an engaging discussion on endurance, mental resilience, and the impact of movement.
 
Event Details
📍
 Location: Wadi Degla Protectorate
📅
 Date: Saturday, March 15th
⏰
 Time: Meeting at 4:30 PM
🥘
 Iftar Meal: Provided by Rowad, distributed at the gate (participants will carry it to the camp).
🚶‍♂️
 Limited Spots: Maximum 30 participants – secure your spot by Tuesday morning.
 
Agenda:
4:30 PM – Meet at Wadi Degla Protectorate Gate
4:45 PM – Start hiking on the south side
5:57 PM – Stop for Iftar 
6:45 PM – Resume hike to Footloose Camp
8:00 PM – Guest speaker talk, group photo, and goodbye
 
This is a fantastic opportunity to connect, recharge, and support a great cause. If you’d like to join, please reply to this email to confirm your participation, and kindly refer to the attached event schedule for more details.
Note: You are welcome to join the hike on any of the available dates, but please note that Rowad will be attending only on March 15th.
 
Looking forward to seeing you on the trail!
 
 
Best regards,
 
يسعدنا دعوتكم إلى حضور مبادرة تسلق للصحة النفسية في رمضان بمحمية وادي دجلة يوم السبت 15 مارس ، بمشاركة المهندس محمد محلب، الرئيس التنفيذي لشركة الرواد، الذي سينضم إلينا في هذه التجربة الملهمة
.
 
سيستضيف التسلق شريف العبد، مدير إستراتيجية استشارات العملاء في أوراكل ورياضي نشط، الذي سيتبرع بمبلغ 50 جنيهًا لكل كيلومتر يُقطع لصالح الجمعيات الخيرية في سيناء، وستقوم رواد بمطابقة تبرعه بناءً على مشاركة الفريق. كما سيستضيف شريف عمر الصاوي، مدرب الجري على الطرق الوعرة والجري لمسافات طويلة، ومؤسس
 Ultra Bedu
، حيث سيقدم جلسة نقاشية حول التحمل، والصمود الذهني، وتأثير الحركة على الصحة النفسية
.
 
تفاصيل الفعالية
:
📍
 
الموقع: محمية وادي دجلة
📅
 
التاريخ: السبت 15 مارس
⏰
 
التوقيت: التجمع الساعة 4:30 مساءً
🥘
 
وجبة الإفطار: مقدمة من رواد، وسيتم توزيعها عند البوابة (يتوجب على المشاركين حملها إلى موقع المخيم)
.
🧗‍♂️
 
أماكن محدودة: الحد الأقصى للمشاركين 30 شخصًا – يرجى تأكيد حضوركم بحلول صباح الثلاثاء
.
 
البرنامج
:
4:30 
مساءً – التجمع عند بوابة محمية وادي دجلة
4:45 
مساءً – بدء التسلق من الجهة الجنوبية
5:57 
مساءً – التوقف لتناول الإفطار
6:45 
مساءً – استئناف التسلق إلى مخيم
 Footloose
8:00 
مساءً – جلسة الضيف المتحدث، صورة جماعية، وختام الفعالية
 
هذه فرصة رائعة للتواصل، واستعادة الطاقة، ودعم قضية إنسانية هادفة. إذا كنت ترغب في الانضمام، يرجى الرد على هذا البريد الإلكتروني لتأكيد مشاركتك، كما يمكنكم الاطلاع على الجدول المرفق لمزيد من التفاصيل
.
ملاحظة: يمكنكم المشاركة في أي من المواعيد المتاحة، ولكن رواد ستكون حاضرة فقط في يوم 15 مارس
.
 
نتطلع لقضاء وقت مميز معكم في هذه التجربة الملهمة
!
 
أطيب التحيات

--- Email 235 ---
Subject: Are You Still Struggling with Complex BI Tools?
From: communications@yellowfinbi.com
Date: 2025-03-07T09:03:26Z
Body:
EXTERNAL EMAIL:
 
This email was sent by a person from outside your organization. Execute caution when clicking links, opening attachments or taking further action, before validating its authenticity.
 
The inside story of turning complex data into business gold. 
 
 
 
Still struggling to turn your data into a strategic asset for your clients? Previously we shared 
Socienta's journey
 of transforming their SaaS platform with Yellowfin's embedded analytics. Today, we're diving deeper into the 
how 
and 
why
 behind their success.
The Strategic Shift: From Data to Decisions
Socienta's CEO, Ghassan Talhouk, recognized a critical challenge facing many SaaS platforms: 
data complexity doesn't equal actionable insights
. Their previous approach left clients drowning in information, but starving for meaningful understanding.
Key Transformation Highlights:
Beyond Visualization: 
Yellowfin didn't just add charts – it reimagined how data could drive strategic decisions for property management professionals.
Seamless Integration: 
The white-labeled solution looked and felt like a native part of Socienta's platform, eliminating friction for end-users.
Scalable Intelligence: 
Multi-tenancy features meant Socienta could efficiently serve diverse clients without compromising performance or customization.
The Competitive Edge
Unlike Power BI, which presented complicated embedding challenges, Yellowfin offered:
Intuitive white-labeling capabilities.
Robust multi-tenant architecture.
Flexible, developer-friendly integration.
Want to learn more about the key differences between Yellowfin and Power BI?
Learn the Key Differences
 
Your Next Step
Imagine transforming your own SaaS platform from a data repository to a strategic decision support system. We're here to make that a reality.

--- Email 240 ---
Subject: How to Price and Sell Your Unique Analytical Application
From: communications@yellowfinbi.com
Date: 2025-03-06T09:02:53Z
Body:
EXTERNAL EMAIL:
 
This email was sent by a person from outside your organization. Execute caution when clicking links, opening attachments or taking further action, before validating its authenticity.
 
The best and most desired outcome for your unique analytical application. 
 
 
 
How to Price Analytics Applications
The best and most desired outcome for your unique analytical application is that it delivers commercial returns, makes it is easy for your sales team to sell, and even easier for your customers to buy. To achieve these outcomes, you have to get the pricing right.
This blog is your guide on how to price and sell your unique analytical application offering and inside you will find:
Analytical applications:
What are they?
Which Pricing Option is for You?
How to Decide on Pricing
Why Simplify Pricing?
How to Introduce Analytics as a User Option
Keep your pricing model consistent
There are many ways that you can price an analytics application, but the most important analytics pricing consideration is always finding the approach that makes the most sense for your unique use cases and business requirements. You want to price your product in a way that is easy for customers to see the value and for your salespeople to sell.
Read How to Price
 
Regardless of which pricing model you choose to adopt, the ultimate goal is always to achieve the best outcome for your business and your customers.
Yellowfin Pricing: Flexible and Tailored For You
Yellowfin pricing is simple, predictable and scalable.
Get Custom Pricing

--- Email 249 ---
Subject: RE: it was CORS and Token security
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-05T11:47:21Z
Body:
After sending the email ,api crashed on windows server cause of Select * From Cost_Dist
 
 
From:
 Omar Essam 
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 5, 2025 1:45 PM
To:
 Ayman Sherif <Ayman.Sherif@rowad-rme.com>
Cc:
 Yasser Abouzeid <yasser.abouzeid@rowad-rme.com>; Nada Namir <nada.namir@rowad-rme.com>
Subject:
 it was CORS and Token security
 
On port 4000 graphql api can both fetch 10.10.11.242 mysql and send to port 3000 next.js
 
 
After the following edits, its working as you can see above,also I fetched thetable users that how I logged in
 
 
The Problem Was
 
Users with no token couldn’t even select the user table for them to login
 
Changed the resolves file to have
 
getUsers: async () => {
  return await runMySQLQuery(
    "SELECT id, username, email, role FROM RME_TEST.users"
  );
},
 
Instead of 
 
 
 
Also changed CORS to give the windows server itself access
 
We have to add a lot of ips
 
const corsOptions = {
  origin: [
    
http://localhost:3000
,
    
https://studio.apollographql.com
,
    
http://10.10.12.223:3000
,
  ],
  credentials: true,
  methods: "GET,POST,OPTIONS",
  allowedHeaders: "Content-Type, Authorization",
};
app.use(cors(corsOptions));
 
After allowing all
 
app.use(cors({
  origin: "*",
  credentials: true,
  methods: "GET,POST,OPTIONS",
  allowedHeaders: "Content-Type, Authorization"
}));
 
 
Only nextjs is allowed here
 
app.use(cors({
  origin: 
http://10.10.11.241:3000
, //  Allow only your Next.js frontend
  credentials: true, //  Allow cookies/auth headers
  methods: "GET,POST,OPTIONS",
  allowedHeaders: "Content-Type, Authorization"
}));
 
Also you cant run queries like select * from a table

--- Email 253 ---
Subject: Tkinter
From: nada.namir@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-05T09:25:25Z
Body:
For building a simple user interface in Python without external dependencies, I recommend using the built-in tkinter library. It comes pre-installed with Python, so you don't need to worry about additional dependencies.
Here’s an easy method to create a user interface that takes input and shows a pop-up screen with the output:
python
Copy
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import messagebox
 
# Function to handle the button click
def show_output():
    user_input = entry.get()  # Get the input from the entry widget
    # Show a pop-up message with the user input
    messagebox.showinfo("Output", f"You entered: {user_input}")
 
# Create the main window
root = tk.Tk()
root.title("Simple UI")
 
# Create a label
label = tk.Label(root, text="Enter something:")
label.pack(pady=10)
 
# Create an entry widget for user input
entry = tk.Entry(root)
entry.pack(pady=10)
 
# Create a button to trigger the pop-up
button = tk.Button(root, text="Show Output", command=show_output)
button.pack(pady=20)
 
# Start the Tkinter event loop
root.mainloop()
Explanation:
tk.Tk()
 creates the main window.
tk.Label
 creates a text label asking the user to input something.
tk.Entry
 creates a text field where the user can type.
tk.Button
 triggers the show_output() function when clicked.
messagebox.showinfo
 shows a pop-up with the output message.
This approach will work without needing to install any additional libraries, as tkinter is bundled with Python by default. Just run this code in your Python environment, and it should display a simple window where you can input text and click the button to show the result in a pop-up.
 
 
 
Best Regards,
------------------------------------------------------------

'
dotenv
'
).

()

=
 require
(

)

)

 cors 
=

(

cors
'
)
;
 
const
 app 
=
 express
()
;
app
.

(
cors
())
;
app
.
use
(

.
json
())
;
 
// Allows API to read JSON requests
 
//  Connect to MySQL on Linux server
const
 db 
=
 mysql
.
createConnection
(
{
    host
:
 
"
10.10.11.242

,

:
 
"
gamal

,

:

:
 
"
RME_TEST
"
,
    port
:
 
3306
,

:
 
true
 
// Allow multiple queries
}
)
;
 
db
.
connect
(
err 
=>
 
{
    
if
 
(
err
)
 
{
        console
.
error
(
"
❌
 MySQL Connection Failed:
"
,
 err
)
;
        process
.
exit
(
1
)
;
 
// Exit process if DB fails to connect
    
}
 
else
 
{
        console
.
log
(
"
✅
 MySQL Connected to RME_TEST
"
)
;
    
}
}
)
;

app
.
get
(
"
/
"
,
 
(
req
,
 res
)
 
=>
 
{
    res
.
send
(
"
✅
 API is running!
"
)
;
}
)
;
 
//  Get All Expenditures
app
.
get
(
"
/expenditures
"
,
 
(
req
,
 res
)
 
=>
 
{
    db
.
query
(
"
SELECT * FROM RME_TEST.RME_Projects_Cost_Dist_Line_Report
"
,
 
(
err
,
 result
)
 
=>
 
{
        
if
 
(
err
)
 
{
            console
.
error
(
"
❌
 MySQL Query Error:
"
,
 err
)
;
            res
.
status
(
500
).
json
(
{
 error
:
 err
.
message 
}
)
;
        
}
 
else
 
{
            res
.
json
(
result
)
;
        
}
    
}
)
;
}
)
;

=
 process
.
env
.
PORT 
||
 
4000
;

.

(

,

.

}`

--- Email 282 ---
Subject: updated logic for message (first 10 days - send last month)
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-02T18:14:08Z
Body:
def
 
split_message
(
text
, 
max_length
):
    
"""Splits a long message into multiple smaller messages for Twilio."""
    words 
=
 text.split()
    parts 
=
 []
    current_part 
=
 
""
    
    
for
 word 
in
 words:
        
if
 
len
(current_part) 
+
 
len
(word) 
+
 
1
 
<=
 max_length:
            current_part 
+=
 
" "
 
+
 word
        
else
:
            parts.append(current_part.strip())
            current_part 
=
 word
    
if
 current_part:
        parts.append(current_part.strip())
    
    
return
 parts
 
try
:
    
print
(
"Connecting to the database..."
)
    dsn 
=
 oracledb.makedsn(hostname, port, 
service_name
=
service_name)
    connection 
=
 oracledb.connect(
user
=
username, 
password
=
password, 
dsn
=
dsn)
    
print
(
"Connected to the database!"
)
 
    cursor 
=
 connection.cursor()
 
    
# 
✅
 Fetch the last 15 cash-in transactions (most recent first)
    query_latest_transactions 
=
 
"""
    SELECT acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID,
           TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS receipt_date,
           TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1)) AS Recipt_amount_EGP,
           acr.comments,
           acr.ATTRIBUTE1  -- Project number
    FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
    WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
    ORDER BY acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID DESC
    FETCH FIRST 15 ROWS ONLY
    """
    cursor.execute(query_latest_transactions)
    results 
=
 cursor.fetchall()
 
    
# 
✅
 Read last processed transactions (Only cash receipt IDs)
    last_transaction 
=
 read_file(last_cash_in_file)
    processed_transactions 
=
 
set
(last_transaction.splitlines()) 
if
 last_transaction 
else
 
set
()
 
    new_transactions 
=
 []
 
    
for
 result 
in
 
reversed
(results):  
# Ensure chronological order
        cash_receipt_id, receipt_date, amount_egp, comment, project_number 
=
 result
 
        
if
 
str
(cash_receipt_id) 
not
 
in
 processed_transactions:
            new_transactions.append((cash_receipt_id, receipt_date, amount_egp, comment, project_number))
 
    
if
 new_transactions:
        
print
(
f
"New transactions found: 
{
len
(new_transactions)
}
. Preparing to send notifications..."
)
 
        
# 
✅
 Construct a single message containing all new transactions
        message 
=
 
"
🆕
 New Cash-In Transactions:
\n\n
"
 
        
for
 cash_receipt_id, receipt_date, amount_egp, comment, project_number 
in
 new_transactions:
            project_name 
=
 project_mapping.get(project_number, 
None
)  
# Get project name if available
 
            message 
+=
 (
                
f
"
⏳
 Date: 
{
receipt_date
}
\n
"
                
+
 (
f
"
🏗️
 Project: 
{
project_name
}
\n
"
 
if
 project_name 
else
 
""
)
                
+
 
f
"
💰
 Amount: 
{
amount_egp
:,}
 EGP
\n
"
                
+
 
f
"
📝
 Comment: 
{
comment 
if
 comment 
else
 
'No comment provided'
}
\n\n
"
            )
 
        
# 
✅
 Get current date information
        today 
=
 datetime.now()
        current_month 
=
 today.strftime(
"
%b
-%y"
)  
# e.g., "Mar-25"
        previous_month 
=
 (today.replace(
day
=
1
) 
-
 timedelta(
days
=
1
)).strftime(
"
%b
-%y"
)  
# e.g., "Feb-25"
 
        
# 
✅
 Fetch total cash-in for the current month
        query_current_month 
=
 
"""
        SELECT SUM(TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1))) AS total_month
        FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
        WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
        AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
        AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
        AND acr.REVERSAL_REASON_CODE IS NULL
        AND TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM') = TO_CHAR(SYSDATE, 'YYYY-MM')
        """
        cursor.execute(query_current_month)
        current_total_result 
=
 cursor.fetchone()
        total_current_month 
=
 current_total_result[
0
] 
if
 current_total_result[
0
] 
else
 
0
 
        
# 
✅
 If today is between 1st and 10th, fetch previous month's total
        
if
 today.day 
<=
 
10
:
            query_previous_month 
=
 
"""
            SELECT SUM(TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1))) AS total_month
            FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
            WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
            AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
            AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
            AND acr.REVERSAL_REASON_CODE IS NULL
            AND TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM') = TO_CHAR(ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -1), 'YYYY-MM')
            """
            cursor.execute(query_previous_month)
            previous_total_result 
=
 cursor.fetchone()
            total_previous_month 
=
 previous_total_result[
0
] 
if
 previous_total_result[
0
] 
else
 
0
 
            
# 
✅
 Display both previous and current month totals
            message 
+=
 
"────────────────────────
\n
"
            message 
+=
 
f
"
🇪🇬
 Total Cash-In for 
{
previous_month
}
: 
{
total_previous_month
:,.2f}
 EGP
\n
"
            message 
+=
 
f
"
🇪🇬
 Total Cash-In for 
{
current_month
}
: 
{
total_current_month
:,.2f}
 EGP
\n
"
 
        
else
:
            
# 
✅
 Display only the current month's total
            message 
+=
 
"────────────────────────
\n
"
            message 
+=
 
f
"
🇪🇬
 Total Cash-In for 
{
current_month
}
: 
{
total_current_month
:,.2f}
 EGP
\n
"
 
        
# 
✅
 Send message to Microsoft Teams
        payload 
=
 {
"text"
: message}
        response 
=
 requests.post(teams_webhook_url, 
json
=
payload, 
verify
=
False
)
        
if
 response.status_code 
==
 
200
:
            
print
(
"
✅
 Message sent to Teams!"
)
        
else
:
            
print
(
f
"
❌
 Failed to send message to Teams: 
{
response.status_code
}
, 
{
response.text
}
"
)
 
        
# 
✅
 Send message via WhatsApp
        client 
=
 Client(TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID, TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN, 
http_client
=
requests.Session())
        client.http_client.verify 
=
 
False
 
        
for
 recipient 
in
 whatsapp_recipients:
            
try
:
                message_parts 
=
 split_message(message, MAX_TWILIO_MESSAGE_LENGTH)
                
for
 part 
in
 message_parts:
                    msg 
=
 client.messages.create(
from_
=
TWILIO_WHATSAPP_NUMBER, 
body
=
part, 
to
=
recipient)
                
print
(
f
"
✅
 WhatsApp message sent to 
{
recipient
}
"
)
            
except
 
Exception
 
as
 e:
                
print
(
f
"
❌
 Error sending WhatsApp message to 
{
recipient
}
: 
{
e
}
"
)
 
        
# 
✅
 Save only the last 15 cash receipt IDs
        latest_transactions 
=
 [
str
(t[
0
]) 
for
 t 
in
 results]
        write_file(last_cash_in_file, 
"
\n
"
.join(latest_transactions))
 
    
else
:
        
print
(
"No new cash-in transactions found."
)
 
except
 oracledb.Error 
as
 error:
    
print
(
f
"
❌
 Error connecting to database: 
{
error
}
"
)
 
finally
:
    
if
 
'cursor'
 
in
 
locals
():
        cursor.close()
    
if
 
'connection'
 
in
 
locals
():
        connection.close()
------------------------------------------------------------

--- Email 291 ---
Subject: RE: repo of next.js app
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-03-02T09:19:39Z
Body:
Current api running at 
http://10.10.11.241:4000/
 on windows server
 
Tested by this index.js to see it fetching
 
require
(
'dotenv'
).
config
();
const
 
express
 
=
 
require
(
'express'
);
const
 
mysql
 
=
 
require
(
'mysql2'
);
const
 
cors
 
=
 
require
(
'cors'
);
 
const
 
app
 
=
 
express
();
app
.
use
(
cors
());
app
.
use
(
express
.
json
()); 
// Allows API to read JSON requests
 
// 
🔹
 Connect to MySQL on Linux server
const
 
db
 
=
 
mysql
.
createConnection
({
    
host:
 
"10.10.11.242"
,
    
user:
 
"gamal"
,
    
password:
 
"password123Y$"
,
    
database:
 
"RME_TEST"
});
 
db
.
connect
(
err
 
=>
 {
    
if
 (
err
) {
        
console
.
error
(
"
❌
 MySQL Connection Failed:"
, 
err
);
    } 
else
 {
        
console
.
log
(
"
✅
 MySQL Connected to RME_TEST"
);
    }
});
 
// 
🔹
 Test API Route
app
.
get
(
"/"
, (
req
, 
res
) 
=>
 {
    
res
.
send
(
"
✅
 API is running!"
);
});
 
// 
🔹
 Get Unique Project Names with Total Amount
app
.
get
(
"/projects-summary"
, (
req
, 
res
) 
=>
 {
    
const
 
query
 
=
 
`
        SELECT PROJECT_NAME, SUM(AMOUNT) AS total_amount 
        FROM RME_Projects_Cost_Dist_Line_Report 
        GROUP BY PROJECT_NAME
        ORDER BY total_amount DESC
        LIMIT 20;`
;
 
    
db
.
query
(
query
, (
err
, 
result
) 
=>
 {
        
if
 (
err
) {
            
res
.
status
(
500
).
json
({ 
error:
 
err
.
message
 });
        } 
else
 {
            
res
.
json
(
result
);
        }
    });
});
 
// 
🔹
 Start API Server on Port 4000
app
.
listen
(
4000
, () 
=>
 {
    
console
.
log
(
"
🚀
 API Server running on http://localhost:4000"
);
});
 
 
Fetch worked on 
http://10.10.11.241:4000/projects-summary
 
Still working on 
http://10.10.11.241:3000/expenditures

🙌

Tolip Al-Narges New Cairo.

 to see the teams and groups, and let’s gear up for an amazing time together! 
🏆
✨

✨

⚽🎾

Here’s an exciting challenge for you! Every day, we’ll ask you to predict which team will win the match. If you guess correctly, you'll win a special prize! 
🎉

Send the name of the team you think will win to 
HR.EmpRelations@rowad-rme.com
.
If you’re right, you’ll receive a special gift! 
🎁
 
Let the fun and competition begin! Who will be the ultimate champion of predictions? 
💬🏆

--- Email 304 ---
Subject: query to get total ordered and delivered amounts for names in each year
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-27T07:09:02Z
Body:
SELECT
 
    
SUM
(
CASE
 
WHEN
 
YEAR
(STR_TO_DATE(APPROVED_DATE, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
)) = 
2022
 
             
AND
 BUYER_NAME 
IN
 (
                 
'Ahmed Ahmed El Zayat, Mr.'
, 
                 
'Ahmed Mostafa Mohamed Aziz, Mr.'
,
                 
'Kareem Ashraf Ali Abo Sarie, Mr.'
,
                 
'Mohamed Ahmed Abd-Elfamid Ammar, Mr.'
,
                 
'Khaled Ezzat Mohamed Nassef, Mr.'
,
                 
'Samer Essam Abdel Fatah Khalifa, Mr.'
             ) 
        
THEN
 UNIT_PRICE_WITH_TAX * QUANTITY_ORDERED 
ELSE
 
0
 
END
) 
AS
 
Ordered_Amount_2022
,
 
    
SUM
(
CASE
 
WHEN
 
YEAR
(STR_TO_DATE(APPROVED_DATE, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
)) = 
2022
 
             
AND
 BUYER_NAME 
IN
 (
                 
'Ahmed Ahmed El Zayat, Mr.'
, 
                 
'Ahmed Mostafa Mohamed Aziz, Mr.'
,
                 
'Kareem Ashraf Ali Abo Sarie, Mr.'
,
                 
'Mohamed Ahmed Abd-Elfamid Ammar, Mr.'
,
                 
'Khaled Ezzat Mohamed Nassef, Mr.'
,
                 
'Samer Essam Abdel Fatah Khalifa, Mr.'
             ) 
        
THEN
 UNIT_PRICE_WITH_TAX * QUANTITY_DELIVERED 
ELSE
 
0
 
END
) 
AS
 Delivered_Amount_2022,
 
    
SUM
(
CASE
 
WHEN
 
YEAR
(STR_TO_DATE(APPROVED_DATE, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
)) = 
2023
 
             
AND
 BUYER_NAME 
IN
 (
                 
'Kareem Ashraf Ali Abo Sarie, Mr.'
,
                 
'Amr Hassan Abou Seriea, Mr.'
, 
                 
'Ahmed Ahmed El Zayat, Mr.'
, 
                 
'Mohamed Ahmed Abd-Elfamid Ammar, Mr.'

, 
                 
'Mark Aziz, Mr.'
             ) 
        
THEN
 UNIT_PRICE_WITH_TAX * QUANTITY_ORDERED 
ELSE
 
0
 
END
) 
AS
 Ordered_Amount_2023,
 
    
SUM
(
CASE
 
WHEN
 
YEAR
(STR_TO_DATE(APPROVED_DATE, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
)) = 
2023
 
             
AND
 BUYER_NAME 
IN
 (
                 
'Kareem Ashraf Ali Abo Sarie, Mr.'
,

,

,

, 
                 
'Mark Aziz, Mr.'
             ) 
        
THEN
 UNIT_PRICE_WITH_TAX * QUANTITY_DELIVERED 
ELSE
 
0

) 
AS
 Delivered_Amount_2023,

--- Email 315 ---
Subject: cash in and out per month per project only org id 83
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-26T14:22:37Z
Body:
WITH
 
Filtered_Projects
 
AS
 (
    
SELECT
 
DISTINCT
 
PROJECT_NAME
    
FROM
 
RME_ap_check_payments_Report
    
WHERE
 
ORG_ID
 = 
83
)
SELECT
 
    
COALESCE
(
in_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
, 
out_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
) 
AS
 
PROJECT_NAME
,
    
COALESCE
(
in_data
.
Month
, 
out_data
.
Month
) 
AS
 
Month
,
    
COALESCE
(
Total_In
, 
0
) 
AS
 
Total_In
,
    
COALESCE
(
Total_Out
, 
0
) 
AS
 
Total_Out
FROM
 
    (
SELECT
 
        
PROJECT_NAME
,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(
RECEIPT_DATE
, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(
FUNC_AMOUNT
) 
AS
 
Total_In
    
FROM
 
SWD_Collection_Report
    
WHERE
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
IN
 (
SELECT
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
FROM
 
Filtered_Projects
)
    
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 
in_data
LEFT
 
JOIN
 
    (
SELECT
 
        
PROJECT_NAME
,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(
CHECK_DATE
, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(
EQUIV
) 
AS
 
Total_Out
    
FROM
 
RME_ap_check_payments_Report
    
WHERE
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
IN
 (
SELECT
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
FROM
 
Filtered_Projects
)
    
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 
out_data
ON
 
in_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
 = 
out_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
 
AND
 
in_data
.
Month
 = 
out_data
.
Month
 
UNION
 
 
SELECT
 
    
COALESCE
(
in_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
, 
out_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
) 
AS
 
PROJECT_NAME
,
    
COALESCE
(
in_data
.
Month
, 
out_data
.
Month
) 
AS
 
Month
,
    
COALESCE
(
Total_In
, 
0
) 
AS
 
Total_In
,
    
COALESCE
(
Total_Out
, 
0
) 
AS
 
Total_Out
FROM
 
    (
SELECT
 
        
PROJECT_NAME
,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(
RECEIPT_DATE
, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(
FUNC_AMOUNT
) 
AS
 
Total_In
    
FROM
 
SWD_Collection_Report
    
WHERE
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
IN
 (
SELECT
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
FROM
 
Filtered_Projects
)
    
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 
in_data
RIGHT
 
JOIN
 
    (
SELECT
 
        
PROJECT_NAME
,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(
CHECK_DATE
, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(
EQUIV
) 
AS
 
Total_Out
    
FROM
 
RME_ap_check_payments_Report
    
WHERE
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
IN
 (
SELECT
 
PROJECT_NAME
 
FROM
 
Filtered_Projects
)
    
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 
out_data
ON
 
in_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
 = 
out_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
 
AND
 
in_data
.
Month
 = 
out_data
.
Month
ORDER
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
Month
;

--- Email 317 ---
Subject: cash in and out query per project per month
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-26T12:25:10Z
Body:
SELECT
 
    
COALESCE
(
in_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
, 
out_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
) 
AS
 
PROJECT_NAME
,
    
COALESCE
(
in_data
.
Month
, 
out_data
.
Month
) 
AS
 
Month
,
    
COALESCE
(
Total_In
, 
0
) 
AS
 
Total_In
,
    
COALESCE
(
Total_Out
, 
0
) 
AS
 
Total_Out
FROM
 
    (
SELECT
 
        
PROJECT_NAME
,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(
RECEIPT_DATE
, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(
FUNC_AMOUNT
) 
AS
 
Total_In
    
FROM
 
SWD_Collection_Report
    
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 
in_data
LEFT
 
JOIN
 
    (
SELECT
 
        
PROJECT_NAME
,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(
CHECK_DATE
, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(
EQUIV
) 
AS
 
Total_Out
    
FROM
 
RME_ap_check_payments_Report
    
GROUP
 
BY
 
PROJECT_NAME
, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 
out_data
ON
 
in_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
 = 
out_data
.
PROJECT_NAME
 
AND
 
in_data
.
Month
 = 
out_data
.
Month
 
UNION
 
 
SELECT
 
    
COALESCE
(in_data.PROJECT_NAME, out_data.PROJECT_NAME) 
AS
 PROJECT_NAME,
    
COALESCE
(in_data.
Month
, out_data.
Month
) 
AS
 
Month
,
    
COALESCE
(Total_In, 
0
) 
AS
 Total_In,
    
COALESCE
(Total_Out, 
0
) 
AS
 Total_Out
FROM
 
    (
SELECT
 
        PROJECT_NAME,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(RECEIPT_DATE, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(FUNC_AMOUNT) 
AS
 Total_In
    
FROM
 SWD_Collection_Report
    
GROUP
 
BY
 PROJECT_NAME, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 in_data
RIGHT
 
JOIN
 
    (
SELECT
 
        PROJECT_NAME,
        
DATE_FORMAT
(STR_TO_DATE(CHECK_DATE, 
'%Y-%m-%d'
), 
'%Y-%m'
) 
AS
 
`Month`
,
        
SUM
(EQUIV) 
AS
 Total_Out
    
FROM
 RME_ap_check_payments_Report
    
GROUP
 
BY
 PROJECT_NAME, 
`Month`
) 
AS
 out_data
ON
 in_data.PROJECT_NAME = out_data.PROJECT_NAME 
AND
 in_data.
Month
 = out_data.
Month
ORDER
 
BY
 PROJECT_NAME, 
Month
;

--- Email 324 ---
Subject: FW: RFQ Budget Lines and Winning Vendor Lines Report
From: yasser.abouzeid@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-25T14:23:34Z
Body:
Best Regards,
Yasser Abouzeid
PMO Manager
+201286177055
 
From:
 Omar Essam <omar.essam@rowad-rme.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 25, 2025 12:08 PM
To:
 Islam Shawky <islam.shawky@rowad-rme.com>; Yasser Abouzeid <yasser.abouzeid@rowad-rme.com>; Alia Khaled <alia.khaled@rowad-rme.com>
Subject:
 RE: RFQ Budget Lines and Winning Vendor Lines Report
 
Function to extract pr no from rfq title
 
def
 
extract_pr_numbers_enhanced
(
title
):
    
matches
 
=
 re.findall(
r
'PR
[
-_ 
]
?
(?:
NO
[
.\s
]
*
)
?
(
\d
+
)
|
pr
[
-_ 
](
\d
+
)
'
, 
title
, re.IGNORECASE)
    
# Flatten and filter out None values from regex match groups
    
pr_numbers
 
=
 [
num
 
for
 
match
 
in
 
matches
 
for
 
num
 
in
 
match
 
if
 
num
]
    
return
 
', '
.
join
(
pr_numbers
) 
if
 
pr_numbers
 
else
 
None
 
# Apply the enhanced function
df[
'PR Number'
] 
=
 df[
'Title of RFQ'
].astype(
str
).apply(
extract_pr_numbers_enhanced
)
 
# Save the updated results to a new file
final_file_path
 
=
 
"PR_Numbers.xlsx"
df.to_excel(
final_file_path
, 
index
=
False
)
 
 
attached are the only lines containing pr numbers + a column with the extract pr no

 Islam Shawky <

From:
 Omar Essam 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 25, 2025 12:08 PM
To:
 Islam Shawky <islam.shawky@rowad-rme.com>; Yasser Abouzeid <yasser.abouzeid@rowad-rme.com>; Alia Khaled <alia.khaled@rowad-rme.com>
Subject:
 RE: RFQ Budget Lines and Winning Vendor Lines Report
 
Function to extract pr no from rfq title
 
def
 
extract_pr_numbers_enhanced
(
title
):
    
matches
 
=
 re.findall(
r
'PR
[
-_ 
]
?
(?:
NO
[
.\s
]
*
)
?
(
\d
+
)
|
pr
[
-_ 
](
\d
+
)
'
, 
title
, re.IGNORECASE)
    
# Flatten and filter out None values from regex match groups
    
pr_numbers
 
=
 [
num
 
for
 
match
 
in
 
matches
 
for
 
num
 
in
 
match
 
if
 
num
]
    
return
 
', '
.
join
(
pr_numbers
) 
if
 
pr_numbers
 
else
 
None
 
# Apply the enhanced function
df[
'PR Number'
] 
=
 df[
'Title of RFQ'
].astype(
str
).apply(
extract_pr_numbers_enhanced
)
 
# Save the updated results to a new file
final_file_path
 
=
 
"PR_Numbers.xlsx"
df.to_excel(
final_file_path
, 
index
=
False
)
 
 
attached are the only lines containing pr numbers + a column with the extract pr no
 
From:

Subject:

Dear all,

--- Email 373 ---
Subject: new cumulative query
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-18T12:06:37Z
Body:
SELECT
 
SUM
(
TRUNC
(
acr
.amount * 
NVL
(
acr
.exchange_rate, 
1
))) 
AS
 
total_month
        
FROM
 
AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL
 
acr
        
WHERE
 
acr
.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = 
'83'
        
AND
 
acr
.ATTRIBUTE1 
IS
 
NOT
 
NULL
        
AND
 
acr
.ATTRIBUTE2 != 
'Manual/Netting'
        
AND
 
acr
.REVERSAL_REASON_CODE 
IS
 
NULL
  
-- Ignore reversed transactions
        
AND
 
TO_CHAR
(
acr
.RECEIPT_DATE, 
'YYYY-MM'
) = 
TO_CHAR
(
SYSDATE
, 
'YYYY-MM'
)
 
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Omar Essam 
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 10:24 AM
To:
 Nada Namir <nada.namir@rowad-rme.com>
Cc:
 Yasser Abouzeid <yasser.abouzeid@rowad-rme.com>
Subject:
 confirm cash in data
 
Query to send message without fetch first row
 
SELECT
 
acr
.CASH_RECEIPT_ID,
           
TO_CHAR
(
acr
.RECEIPT_DATE, 
'YYYY-MM-DD'
) 
AS
 
receipt_date
,
           
TRUNC
(
acr
.amount * 
NVL
(
acr
.exchange_rate, 
1
)) 
AS
 
Recipt_amount_EGP
,
           
acr
.comments,
           
acr
.ATTRIBUTE1  
-- Project number
    
FROM
 
AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL
 
acr
    
WHERE
 
acr
.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = 
'83'
      
AND
 
acr
.ATTRIBUTE1 
IS
 
NOT
 
NULL
      
AND
 
acr
.ATTRIBUTE2 != 
'Manual/Netting'
    
ORDER
 
BY
 
acr
.CASH_RECEIPT_ID 
DESC
 
 
The resulting excel is attached called “table to write message”
 
Also the fact table of cash receipt is attached

Dear Rowad Family,
As we continue growing and evolving, we're excited to share something new with you all! We've just launched Rowad Investment, It's a big step for us, and we want *YOU* to be a part of it.
To stay up to date with all the amazing projects and opportunities that Rowad Investment will be pursuing, we’ve created new pages on LinkedIn and Instagram. These platforms will be where we share news, updates, and the progress of our journey.
Being a part of Rowad means you’re not just an employee – you’re a key part of everything we do. So, join us online to stay connected with our latest ventures, and let’s continue building success together.
 
Our Platforms 
Instagram 
   |

عائلة الرواد،
 
 
 بينما نواصل النمو والتطور، نحن متحمسون لمشاركة شيء جديد معكم جميعاً! لقد قمنا بإطلاق شركة  
Rowad Investment 
 وهى خطوة كبيرة بالنسبة لنا، ونريدكم أن تكونوا جزءاً منها
 
لنبقى على اتصال معكم وتشاركونا كل ما هو جديد، قمنا بإنشاء صفحات سوشيال ميديا على "لينكد إن" و "إنستجرام". ستجدون هناك آخر التحديثات والأخبار المتعلقة بمشاريعنا القادمة
.
 
كونكم جزءاً من الرواد يعني أنكم لستم مجرد موظفين – أنتم شريك أساسي في هذا النجاح. لذا انضموا إلينا على هذه الصفحات لتكونوا دائماً على إطلاع بكل جديد، ولنبني معاً نجاح مستمر
.
 
ترقبوا منشوراتنا الجديدة، وشاركوا أفكاركم وحماسكم. في النهاية، هذه الرحلة هي عنكم كما هي عن الشركة

To:

Cc:
 Yasser Abouzeid <yasser.abouzeid@rowad-rme.com>; Nada Namir <nada.namir@rowad-rme.com>
Subject:
 Python code to send Cash In Message
 
requirements to run
 
oracle client 21.15 to be in C:\oracle\
pip install oracledb 2.5.1
 
query to get latest cash in :
 
    SELECT acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID,
           TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS receipt_date,
           TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1)) AS Recipt_amount_EGP,
           acr.comments,
           acr.ATTRIBUTE1  -- Project number
    FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
    WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
    ORDER BY acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID DESC
    FETCH FIRST 1 ROW ONLY
    """
    
query to get total cash in for current month :
 
        SELECT SUM(TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1))) AS total_month
        FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
        WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
          AND TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM') = TO_CHAR(SYSDATE, 'YYYY-MM')

# Helper functions to read/write from/to text files
def
 
read_file
(
file_path
):
    
if
 
os
.
path
.
exists
(
file_path
):
        
with
 
open
(
file_path
, 
"r"
, 
encoding
=
"utf-8"
) 
as
 
file
:
            
return
 
file
.
read
().
strip
()
    
return
 
""
 
def
 
write_file
(
file_path
, 
content
):
    
with
 
open
(
file_path
, 
"w"
, 
encoding
=
"utf-8"
) 
as
 
file
:
        
file
.
write
(
content
)
 
try
:
    
print
(
"Connecting to the database..."
)
    
# Connect to the database
    
dsn
 
=
 
oracledb
.makedsn(
hostname
, 
port
, 
service_name
=
service_name
)
    
connection
 
=
 
oracledb
.connect(
user
=
username
, 
password
=
password
, 
dsn
=
dsn
)
    
print
(
"Connected to the database!"
)
 
    
# Create a cursor
    
cursor
 
=
 
connection
.cursor()
 
    
# Query to get the latest cash-in transaction
    
query_latest_transaction
 
=
 
"""
    SELECT acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID,
           TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS receipt_date,
           TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1)) AS Recipt_amount_EGP,
           acr.comments,
           acr.ATTRIBUTE1  -- Project number
    FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
    WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
    ORDER BY acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID DESC
    FETCH FIRST 1 ROW ONLY
    """
    
    
cursor
.execute(
query_latest_transaction
)
    
result
 
=
 
cursor
.fetchone()
 
    
if
 
result
:
        
# Extract the latest transaction details
        
cash_receipt_id
, 
receipt_date
, 
amount_egp
, 
comment
, 
project_number
 
=
 
result
        
        
# Extract project name from mapping, if available
        
project_name
 
=
 
project_mapping
.
get
(
project_number
, 
None
)
 
        
# Query to get the total cash-in for the current month
        
query_total_month
 
=
 
f
"""
        SELECT SUM(TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1))) AS total_month
        FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
        WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
          AND TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM') = TO_CHAR(SYSDATE, 'YYYY-MM')
        """
        
        
cursor
.execute(
query_total_month
)
        
total_month_result
 
=
 
cursor
.fetchone()
        
total_month
 
=
 
total_month_result
[
0
] 
if
 
total_month_result
[
0
] 
else
 
0
 
        
# Construct transaction identifier
        
current_transaction
 
=
 
f
"
{
cash_receipt_id
}
|
{
receipt_date
}
|
{
amount_egp
}
|
{
comment
.strip()
}
"
        
print
(
f
"Fetched transaction from database: 
{
current_transaction
}
"
)
 
        
# Read the last cash-in stored locally
        
last_transaction
 
=
 
read_file
(
last_cash_in_file
)
 
        
if
 
current_transaction
 
!=
 
last_transaction
:
            
print
(
"New transaction found! Preparing to send to Teams..."
)
            
            
# Construct the message
            
message
 
=
 
"New Cash-In Transaction:
\n
"
            
if
 
project_name
:  
# Only include project if it's found
                
message
 
+=
 
f
"
🏗️
 Project: 
{
project_name
}
\n
"
            
message
 
+=
 (
                
f
"
📅
 Date: 
{
receipt_date
}
\n
"
                
f
"
💰
 Amount: 
{
amount_egp
:,}
 EGP
\n
"
                
f
"
📝
 Comment: 
{
comment
 
if
 
comment
 
else
 
'No comment provided'
}
\n
"
                
f
"
🇪🇬
 Total Cash-In for 
{
receipt_date
[:
7
]
}
: 
{
total_month
:,.2f}
 EGP"
            )
 
            
# Check if the message is already sent
            
last_message
 
=
 
read_file
(
last_message_file
)
            
if
 
message
 
!=
 
last_message
:
                
# Send the message to Microsoft Teams with SSL verification enabled
                
payload
 
=
 {
"text"
: 
message
}
                
response
 
=
 
requests
.
post
(
teams_webhook_url
, 
json
=
payload
, 
verify
=
certificate_path
)
 
                
if
 
response
.
status_code
 
==
 
200
:
                    
print
(
"Message sent to Microsoft Teams successfully!"
)
 
                    
# Update the files
                    
write_file
(
last_cash_in_file
, 
current_transaction
)
                    
write_file
(
last_message_file
, 
message
)
                
else
:
                    
print
(
f
"Failed to send message. Status code: 
{
response
.
status_code
}
, Response: 
{
response
.
text
}
"
)
            
else
:
                
print
(
"Message already sent. No duplicate message sent to Teams."
)
        
else
:
            
print
(
"No new cash-in transactions found."
)
    
else
:
        
print
(
"No cash-in transactions found in the database."
)
 
except
 
oracledb
.Error 
as
 
error
:
    
print
(
f
"Error connecting to database: 
{
error
}
"
)
 
finally
:
    
# Close the cursor and connection
    
try
:
        
if
 
'cursor'
 
in
 
locals
() 
and
 
cursor
 
is
 
not
 
None
:
            
cursor
.close()
    
except
 
oracledb
.Error 
as
 
error
:
        
print
(
f
"Error while closing cursor: 
{
error
}
"
)
 
    
try
:
        
if
 
'connection'
 
in
 
locals
() 
and
 
connection
 
is
 
not
 
None
:
            
connection
.close()
    
except
 
oracledb
.Error 
as
 
error
:
        
print
(
f
"Error while closing connection: 
{
error
}
"
)

Subject: Python code to send Cash In Message
From: omar.essam@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-17T10:34:42Z
Body:
requirements to run
 
oracle client 21.15 to be in C:\oracle\
pip install oracledb 2.5.1
 
query to get latest cash in :
 
    SELECT acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID,
           TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS receipt_date,
           TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1)) AS Recipt_amount_EGP,
           acr.comments,
           acr.ATTRIBUTE1  -- Project number
    FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
    WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
    ORDER BY acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID DESC
    FETCH FIRST 1 ROW ONLY
    """
    
query to get total cash in for current month :
 
        SELECT SUM(TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1))) AS total_month
        FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
        WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
          AND TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM') = TO_CHAR(SYSDATE, 'YYYY-MM')

(

)

.

(

, 
"last_cash_in.txt"
)

)

# Helper functions to read/write from/to text files
def
 
read_file
(
file_path
):
    
if
 
os
.
path
.
exists
(
file_path
):
        
with
 
open
(
file_path
, 
"r"
, 
encoding
=
"utf-8"
) 
as
 
file
:
            
return
 
file
.
read
().
strip
()
    
return
 
""
 
def
 
write_file
(
file_path
, 
content
):
    
with
 
open
(
file_path
, 
"w"
, 
encoding
=
"utf-8"
) 
as
 
file
:
        
file
.
write
(
content
)
 
try
:
    
print
(
"Connecting to the database..."
)
    
# Connect to the database
    
dsn
 
=
 
oracledb
.makedsn(
hostname
, 
port
, 
service_name
=
service_name
)
    
connection
 
=
 
oracledb
.connect(
user
=
username
, 
password
=
password
, 
dsn
=
dsn
)
    
print
(
"Connected to the database!"
)
 
    
# Create a cursor
    
cursor
 
=
 
connection
.cursor()
 
    
# Query to get the latest cash-in transaction
    
query_latest_transaction
 
=
 
"""
    SELECT acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID,
           TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM-DD') AS receipt_date,
           TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1)) AS Recipt_amount_EGP,
           acr.comments,
           acr.ATTRIBUTE1  -- Project number
    FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
    WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
      AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
    ORDER BY acr.CASH_RECEIPT_ID DESC
    FETCH FIRST 1 ROW ONLY
    """
    
    
cursor
.execute(
query_latest_transaction
)
    
result
 
=
 
cursor
.fetchone()
 
    
if
 
result
:
        
# Extract the latest transaction details
        
cash_receipt_id
, 
receipt_date
, 
amount_egp
, 
comment
, 
project_number
 
=
 
result
        
        
# Extract project name from mapping, if available
        
project_name
 
=
 
project_mapping
.
get
(
project_number
, 
None
)
 
        
# Query to get the total cash-in for the current month
        
query_total_month
 
=
 
f
"""
        SELECT SUM(TRUNC(acr.amount * NVL(acr.exchange_rate, 1))) AS total_month
        FROM AR_CASH_RECEIPTS_ALL acr
        WHERE acr.ATTRIBUTE_CATEGORY = '83'
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE1 IS NOT NULL
          AND acr.ATTRIBUTE2 != 'Manual/Netting'
          AND TO_CHAR(acr.RECEIPT_DATE, 'YYYY-MM') = TO_CHAR(SYSDATE, 'YYYY-MM')
        """
        
        
cursor
.execute(
query_total_month
)
        
total_month_result
 
=
 
cursor
.fetchone()
        
total_month
 
=
 
total_month_result
[
0
] 
if
 
total_month_result
[
0
] 
else
 
0
 
        
# Construct transaction identifier
        
current_transaction
 
=
 
f
"
{
cash_receipt_id
}
|
{
receipt_date
}
|
{
amount_egp
}
|
{
comment
.strip()
}
"
        
print
(
f
"Fetched transaction from database: 
{
current_transaction
}
"
)
 
        
# Read the last cash-in stored locally
        
last_transaction
 
=
 
read_file
(
last_cash_in_file
)
 
        
if
 
current_transaction
 
!=
 
last_transaction
:
            
print
(
"New transaction found! Preparing to send to Teams..."
)
            
            
# Construct the message
            
message
 
=
 
"New Cash-In Transaction:
\n
"
            
if
 
project_name
:  
# Only include project if it's found
                
message
 
+=
 
f
"
🏗️
 Project: 
{
project_name
}
\n
"
            
message
 
+=
 (
                
f
"
📅
 Date: 
{
receipt_date
}
\n
"
                
f
"
💰
 Amount: 
{
amount_egp
:,}
 EGP
\n
"
                
f
"
📝
 Comment: 
{
comment
 
if
 
comment
 
else
 
'No comment provided'
}
\n
"
                
f
"
🇪🇬
 Total Cash-In for 
{
receipt_date
[:
7
]
}
: 
{
total_month
:,.2f}
 EGP"
            )
 
            
# Check if the message is already sent
            
last_message
 
=
 
read_file
(
last_message_file
)
            
if
 
message
 
!=
 
last_message
:
                
# Send the message to Microsoft Teams with SSL verification enabled
                
payload
 
=
 {
"text"
: 
message
}
                
response
 
=
 
requests
.
post
(
teams_webhook_url
, 
json
=
payload
, 
verify
=
certificate_path
)
 
                
if
 
response
.
status_code
 
==
 
200
:
                    
print
(
"Message sent to Microsoft Teams successfully!"
)
 
                    
# Update the files
                    
write_file
(
last_cash_in_file
, 
current_transaction
)
                    
write_file
(
last_message_file
, 
message
)
                
else
:
                    
print
(
f
"Failed to send message. Status code: 
{
response
.
status_code
}
, Response: 
{
response
.
text
}
"
)
            
else
:
                
print
(
"Message already sent. No duplicate message sent to Teams."
)
        
else
:
            
print
(
"No new cash-in transactions found."
)
    
else
:
        
print
(
"No cash-in transactions found in the database."
)
 
except
 
oracledb
.Error 
as
 
error
:
    
print
(
f
"Error connecting to database: 
{
error
}
"
)
 
finally
:
    
# Close the cursor and connection
    
try
:
        
if
 
'cursor'
 
in
 
locals
() 
and
 
cursor
 
is
 
not
 
None
:
            
cursor
.close()
    
except
 
oracledb
.Error 
as
 
error
:
        
print
(
f
"Error while closing cursor: 
{
error
}
"
)
 
    
try
:
        
if
 
'connection'
 
in
 
locals
() 
and
 
connection
 
is
 
not
 
None
:
            
connection
.close()
    
except
 
oracledb
.Error 
as
 
error
:
        
print
(
f
"Error while closing connection: 
{
error
}
"
)
------------------------------------------------------------

--- Email 387 ---
Subject: RME SODIC Parking 
From: ghada.koraiem@rowad-rme.com
Date: 2025-02-16T14:37:38Z
Body:
Dear All,
I have distributed car access cards for the basement parking to all those entitled to park there. 
Accordingly, I would like to inform you of the following changes, effective Sunday, 23rd February:
 
Basement Parking
:
Access to basement parking will be restricted to those who are authorized to park there. Only vehicles with an access card marked with the assigned slot number in the basement will be allowed entry. Any vehicles found parked in unauthorized spots will incur a penalty of 2,000 per instance, as per Sodic's regulations.
Important
: In case you lose your access card, it will be cancelled from Sodic system, and a fee of 500 L.E will be charged for a replacement card.
 
Ground Floor Service Parking
:
As previously communicated by Sodic, parking in the service area on the ground floor will be on a "first come, first served" basis. We advise that you arrive early to secure a spot, as we will not be able to assist if you arrive late.
 
Visitors
:
For those visiting the headquarters, the driver will drop you off in front of the building. The driver will wait for you either outside the compound or on the ground floor, if parking spaces are available.
 
Company’s Vehicles
:
Company’s vehicles are required to arrive in the early morning, as there are no available spaces in the basement for parking.
 
Please ensure that you follow these new guidelines as per Sodic's regulations.
 
Thank you for your cooperation.
Best regards,
السادة الزمالء  الأعزاء،
بالاشارة الى الموضوع اعلاه
لقد تم توزيع الكروت الخاصة بركن السيارات فى الجراج الخاص بسوديك  
نود إعلامكم بالتغييرات التالية المتعلقة بترتيبات مواقف السيارات، اعتبارًا من يوم الأحد 23 فبراير
:
مواقف السيارات في الجراج
:
سيتم التقيد باستخدام مواقف السيارات في الجراج للمديرين المصرح لهم فقط  باستخدام الجراج. 
و
السيارات التي تحمل بطاقة دخول  مع الرقم المخصص للموقف في الجراج  فقط ستسطيع الدخول.
 
برجاء المحافظة على كروت الدخول حيث انها فى حالة الفقد سيتم تحمل التكلفة 500 جنيه للكارت.
 
 
. سيتم فرض غرامة  من سوديك قدرها 2000 لكل مرة على السيارات المتوقفة في أماكن غير مخصصة لها  
فى الجراج 
 ، وفقًا للوائح سُودِيك
.
 
مواقف السيارات في الطابق الأرضي (الخدمة)
:
كما تم التنبيه  من قبل سُودِيك، فإن مواقف السيارات في منطقة الخدمة في الطابق الأرضي ستكون على أساس "من يأتي أولاً يُخدم أولاً". نوصي بالحضور في وقت مبكر لتأمين مكان لركن السيارة، حيث لا يمكننا تقديم المساعدة إذا وصلتم متأخرين
.
 
مديرو المشاريع والزوار من المشروعات : 
بالنسبة لأولئك الذين يزورون المقر الرئيسي، سيتوقف السائق أمام المبنى ليتم إنزالكم. سيقوم السائق بالانتظار إما خارج الكومباوند  أو في الطابق الأرضي إذا كانت هناك أماكن متاحة.
 
سيارات الشركة
:
استاذ بلال
: 
برجاء التنبيه على سائقين
 سيارات 
الشركة 
  الوصول في الصباح الباكرلحجز اماكن فى الدور الارضى، حيث لا توجد أماكن متاحة في الجراج لركن السيارات بصفة مستمرة. 
 
يرجى التأكد على الالتزام بهذه اللوائح الجديدة وفقًا لتعليمات سُودِيك
.
------------------------------------------------------------

Gym Offers 💪🚀🏋️
Dear Team,
 
Your well-being is our top priority! And we want to support you in staying active and feeling at your best. Through these partnerships, you’ll get special discounted rates to access top-notch gym facilities. 🏋️‍♀️
 
We’re excited to announce that Rowad Modern Engineering has partnered with H2O Gym and Body Factory Gym to bring you exclusive discounts!
 
 
💪 Don’t miss out on this amazing opportunity! Take advantage of this offer and make your health a priority today!
 
For more details on how to sign up, feel free to reach out! 📩
 
Stay active, stay strong! 🚀🏆

Nurseries Announcement👶🎨🌱
🌟 Great News for Our Amazing RME Team! 🌟
 
We’ve got something exciting just for you! At Rowad Modern Engineering, we care about you. Based on the valuable feedback you shared with us through the recent survey, we hear you, and we’ve been working hard to bring you something special. We’ve partnered with four top nurseries in New Cairo to offer you exclusive discounts, fun winter & summer camps, and more! This way, your little ones can have a fun, safe, and enriching experience while you focus on your career. 👶🎨🌱
 
And here’s the best part…✨
We’re introducing a brand-new exclusive benefit just for our amazing
 
female employees!
 ✨
 
Want to know more? We’d love to hear from you! 💌
📧 
HR.EmpRelations@rowad-rme.com
📞 Hayam Gamal: 01271609991
📞 Ahmed Shawky: 01284614896
 
We appreciate you and everything you do—this is just one more way we’re making work-life balance smoother for our incredible team. 
 
Thank you for being part of the Rowad family!
